bug.summary: Mention that Pylint must be installed to run make check_pylint
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
The last step of the Generate Documentation section of <denchmark-link:https://docs.opencv.org/master/d4/db1/tutorial_documentation.html>Writing Documentation</denchmark-link> says to run to test Python code. This will not work for beginners who did not previously have pylint installed because check_pylint doesn't appear in the Makefile after running cmake. appears when running the cmake command, so the rule is skipped. The step is slightly misleading since it does not mention this, especially for anyone who didn't know about Pylint before reading the guide. I'd like to make a PR to make it clear. <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
